Stu Shepard.Action: Declines to engage with Mario, citing being busy and dismissing him quickly.
Takes excellent care of himself, appears confident and well-prepared with crisp attire and grooming.
Attempts to use a phone booth known to be frequently burglarized but does not immediately address the risks or precautions related to it.
Politely but firmly deflects Mario's attempt to engage him, indicating focus on his priorities.
Offers to stop in for lunch and attempts to support Mario's restaurant by lining up a food critic.
Dismisses Mario's frustration and deflects blame by emphasizing his own reputation and promising future help.
Acknowledges Mario's complaints and tries to placate him by asking to make it up to him.
Avoids direct confrontation or honest admission about failures, preserving image over transparency.
Offers to arrange a high-profile party for Mario's place despite it not being firmed up, trying to help out.
Suggests involving Harry's daughter as a free added attraction, showing consideration for Mario’s business.
Uses some flattery and promotional promises to persuade Mario, which may be insincere.
Places an arm around Mario, makes light of insults from childhood showing resilience and a sense of humor, and does not hold a grudge against Mario despite his rudeness.
Slides phone booth door closed in Mario's face, ignoring his frustration and walking off annoyed.
Uses affectionate and flattering language when speaking to Mavis on the phone, calling her 'sweet creature' and 'loveliest individual on earth'.
Encourages Mavis not to quit her job despite her loneliness.
Lightly teases Mavis about her nails, admits improvement since she started looking after him.
Acknowledges the difficulties and lack of loyalty in his profession openly and sincerely.
Responds to Mavis saying 'Don't go' with reassurance that he was not saying goodbye to her.
Explains the limitations of his work and the challenges he faces competently, showing awareness of his professional environment and its difficulties.
Refuses to let Mavis quit her job impulsively, advising practical caution.
Acknowledges his own grooming has improved under Mavis' care, showing self-awareness and openness.
Appears resigned to client loyalty issues and competition without proposing proactive solutions.
Yells at a man impatiently waiting to use the phone booth, telling him off rudely and showing no consideration.
Expresses concern about not hurting Kelly and acknowledges she is a decent individual.
Firmly refuses to be rushed by the businessman waiting to use the phone booth, asserting control over the situation.
Demonstrates awareness of privacy and legal risks by choosing to use a phone booth instead of a traceable phone.
Engages in somewhat defensive and confrontational communication with the waiting businessman, potentially exacerbating tension.
Shows emotional ambivalence and rationalizes infidelity, indicating a lack of decisiveness or strong ethical boundaries.
Suggests meeting Mavis for a drink and shows a playful, complimentary side by praising her appearance and referencing a thoughtful gift.
Is upfront with Mavis about their relationship, implies honesty and straightforwardness.
Deceptively plans to keep an evening open by lying about Knicks tickets to Kelly.
Makes a confident plan to meet Mavis, manages the cover story about Knicks tickets, and quickly arranges a favor via a call to a columnist.
Fails to secure the favor from the columnist quickly as the line is already full despite his confident request.
Offers reciprocal information rather than asking for favors.
Claims intentions are entirely honorable.
Dismisses and talks back rudely to the unknown caller (e.g., 'Get lost!').
Offers reciprocal information to the columnist to gain leverage.
Provides a rumor he claims from a doorman, but fails to realize the information is already public and known by the columnist from the maid and paper.
Appears pleased after the call, even though the information he tried to trade was already outdated or refuted.
Responds calmly but somewhat dismissively to the threatening phone call, asking questions rather than panicking.
Shows nervousness and looks around when the caller demonstrates knowledge of his clothing and proximity.
Plays along with the voice's game briefly but tries to end the conversation.
Mocks the voice by suggesting he might be a shut-in and guesses about ex-wife and child support without concern.
Expresses disinterest and bluntly tells the voice to pester somebody else.
Refuses to engage with the VOICE, calling him a 'creep' and dismissing his intrusion.
Asserts his boundaries and insists that his personal reasons are his business.
Responds with sarcasm and vulgarity to threatening voice
Maintains defiant attitude despite threats
Responds defiantly and sarcastically to threatening calls without showing outward fear.
Looks around nervously and attempts to assess the situation by observing surroundings carefully.
Fails to control or de-escalate the situation despite clearly being threatened and monitored.
Shouts at Mavis to hang up the phone, attempts to protect her from the manipulative voice.
Does not engage in conversation or attempt to clarify the situation directly, instead staying silent and only shouting at Mavis.
Listens helplessly while the Voice manipulates Mavis and invades his privacy without intervening effectively.
Shouts urgent commands to Mavis to hang up the phone but is ignored, showing limited control of the situation.
Yells to stop Mavis from saying more, telling her to keep her big mouth shut.
Ignores Felicia tapping on the glass, showing disinterest in helping others while distracted.
Yells at Mavis to not tell anything else to the voice on the phone.
Ignores Felicia waiting to use the phone, showing distraction and lack of situational awareness.
Calls Mavis derogatory names and speaks abusively, undermining his ability to manage the situation calmly.
Insists that he cares despite accusations, tries to deny negative statements about himself.
Tells Felicia to go away while she is persistently trying to get in the phone booth.
Expresses anger and calls the harassing voice a 'total asshole', showing defense of self and others.
Denies accusations and insists he cares despite contrary evidence.
Attempts to stay focused on the phone call despite Felicia's persistent interruptions.
Rejects the antagonist's threats and refuses to give in or make the suggested calls.
Shows frustration and anger in response to manipulation but does not appear to have a strategic response.
Expresses concern about hurting Kelly, acknowledges her loyalty and support.
Downplays his own 'strange' behavior as insignificant, tries to rationalize infidelity in a metaphor about needing a 'vacation' from a stable relationship.
Questions the caller's knowledge and threats, showing skepticism.
Is shocked by the caller knowing his phone number and name, indicating he is somewhat unprepared for the situation.
Attempts to rationalize his infidelity to justify his behavior, showing evasiveness but also quick thinking.
Responds to threats with frustration and anger rather than a strategic plan or calmness.
Refuses to yield the phone booth to Felicia despite her urgent need, jams the door on her hand when she tries to get in.
Dismisses Felicia's emergency and tells her to go somewhere else, showing impatience and lack of concern.
Refers to Felicia's complaint sarcastically ('Let me hear from your lawyer!') after jamming the door.
Calls Kelly and says 'Honey, it's me,' showing familiarity and possible affection.
Jams the sliding door shut on Felicia's hand to prevent her from entering the booth.
Calmly follows instructions to hold the cellular phone where the Voice can see and dials slowly and carefully.
Insists he is not done and tells Felicia to find another place to make her call instead of giving up the booth, showing persistence.
Responds confidently and sarcastically to Felicia's threat about assault, indicating emotional control but possibly poor judgment.
Keeps cool when the phone rings multiple times without an answer and follows instructions to keep letting it ring.
Calls Kelly and expresses love to her sincerely.
Criticizes Mario's restaurant and calls it a 'dump' with a roach problem.
Explains to Kelly patiently why he is in the phone booth and tries to reassure her.
Denies knowledge about the man who called Kelly while seeming evasive.
Decides not to eat at a restaurant with a poor health rating, showing awareness and good judgment.
Steps into a phone booth to avoid loud traffic noise, showing practical quick thinking.
Answers questions confidently and provides plausible explanations during the call.
Appears confused or evasive when questioned about a mysterious phone call from 15 minutes ago.
Speaks bluntly and dismissively to Kelly about her concerns and feelings, telling her not to 'start that shit again' and deflecting her fear.
Replies shortly and non-reassuringly to Kelly's urgent requests to come home, showing little empathy or attentiveness.
Explains his business activity clearly and shows awareness of his contacts and purpose of calls.
Dismisses Kelly's concerns and avoids addressing the fear detected in his voice.
Maintains composure and tries to deflect emotional tension by challenging Kelly's statements.
Expresses concern for Kelly, insists she never did harm to the antagonist, and claims he never laid a hand on his women and always treated them decently.
Admits to still loving Kelly and being unwilling to let her go.
Refuses to be manipulated by the antagonist and attempts to end the call despite threats.
Questions Kelly's account and tries to get more information despite the threatening situation.
Expresses clear emotional attachment to Kelly and states personal moral standards about how he treats women.
Attempts to end the threatening call decisively by saying 'This call is ended.'
Allows himself to be psychologically manipulated and threatened by the caller without clear countermeasures or escape plan.
Responds to threats with sarcasm and defiance.
Acknowledges being hung up on frequently and seems resigned to it.
Questions and challenges the VOICE aggressively and sarcastically, showing defiance rather than careful assessment.
Fails to take the VOICE's threats seriously, expresses disbelief ('I'm supposed to believe that?').
Engages in a tense negotiation rather than panicking, trying to understand the situation by asking questions.
Expresses understanding toward other salespeople; claims he would never be rude to a fellow salesperson.
Continuously cooperates with the Voice, showing engagement and attempts to connect.
Accurately follows and identifies movements of an unseen threat on his body, showing focus and calm under pressure.
Responds calmly and tries to reason with the voice, showing self-control and confidence in a stressful situation.
Refuses to panic or try reckless escape plans despite extreme intimidation, choosing to cooperate, indicating sound judgment.
Plea to avoid being disconnected, showing vulnerability and fear.
Describes his job as manipulating media to protect people, including managing to shield an employee's reputation.
Recalls details about a murder case on the spot when questioned, showing alertness and some situational awareness.
Tries to bargain with the Voice to avoid disconnection, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Admits he does not know everything about the murder but attempts to cooperate and provide what he knows, demonstrating honesty and controlled communication.
Describes his job and the work he does in pragmatic terms, indicating familiarity with his role and confidence in explaining it.
Protected a member of his group from exposure by ensuring the cops used his real name instead of his stage name.
Admits his limitations and lack of reliability as a journalist on hard news.
Shows casual and somewhat dismissive attitude about convincing celebrities to participate.
Successfully intervenes to protect a colleague from legal trouble by ensuring use of a real name instead of a stage name.
Admits he lacks reliable connections for breaking major hard news and acknowledges his poor record in hard news reporting.
Honestly assesses his strengths, knowing he specializes in celebrity gossip and personal lives rather than serious journalism.
Struggles to confidently secure participation from major news figures when pressed, responding with uncertainty or dismissiveness.
Reluctantly agrees to call Liz Smith and convey a worryingly truthful message to her despite the dangerous and tense context.
Makes a practical but somewhat cynical observation that Liz Smith responds better if a celebrity was involved, showing some social awareness but also a hint of manipulation.
Follows through on a difficult, tense phone call to warn Liz Smith about upcoming danger, showing sincerity and concern for others' safety.
Shows concern and tries to negotiate to avoid harm to others (urges not to shoot).
Admits he was not fully convincing, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Engages calmly under extreme pressure, tries to deescalate situation.
Answers the phone calmly despite being targeted by a sniper; responds with measured acknowledgment ('I do', 'At least ninety-five percent, easy').
Admits to not really believing his own words when trying to convince the sniper, showing some self-doubt and lack of full confidence.
Keeps communication open, attempts to negotiate and reason with the sniper rather than panic.
Mentions trying to reach cable NBC to escalate or get support, showing situational awareness and resourcefulness.
Confidently refuses to leave the phone booth despite threats from Leon, warns he'll call the cops.
Admits 'I can't' to vacate the booth and says 'I can't explain it' to Felicia, showing some opacity or withholding of information.
Attempts to set up the Voice with a proper communicator and shows some creativity in conversation.
Offers all his available money and a valuable watch to Leon to make him go away.
Apologizes for speaking harshly to Felicia and causing her injury.
Does not show any force or aggression despite Leon's threats.
Needs to keep call going despite the tense situation, demonstrating a commitment to responsibility and patience.
Does not convince Felicia that he sincerely means his apology.
Offers all his cash and his valuable watch to Leon in an attempt to buy off the threat and get him to leave.
Apologizes to Felicia for injuring her and tries to smooth over the situation.
Refuses to hang up the phone to avoid losing the call, showing concern for the situation at hand.
Gives away all his money and valuables quickly without showing a clear negotiation strategy or contingency plan, and ultimately remains threatened.
Allows Leon to keep the phone booth and continues to be pressured despite giving all he has, indicating ineffectiveness in the situation.
Tosses his valuable pinky ring to Felicia with an apologetic tone
Acknowledges Leon's territorial rights and pays a license fee to maintain occupancy of the phone booth
Asks Leon to leave him in peace firmly but without hostility
Removes his ring himself despite Leon grabbing his hand, shows persistence and ability to act under physical constraint.
Maintains composure and attempts to keep conversation minimal and controlled ('Nothing. Talk. That's all.').
Acknowledges poor conditions of the phone booth with a light comment ('I knew it smelled for some reason.'), indicating situational awareness.
Responds calmly and logically to Leon's accusations ('No, you didn't. It was a fair and equitable deal...'), showing ability to reason and negotiate.
Admits physical weakness ('You look like you're ready to piss yourself.' / 'Because I am.'), showing vulnerability.
Does not resist or fight despite being in uncomfortable and possibly threatening situation; may indicate passivity or lack of assertiveness.
Responds to Leon's concern with sarcasm and denial about his health.
Tells Leon to wash his hands after complaining about germs on the money.
Threatens to throw up if Leon touches him.
Refuses to vacate the booth despite tension and possible illness.
Calmly insists on continuing his conversation despite others' concerns, maintains control over situation in the phone booth.
Dismisses others' worries with arrogance and hostility rather than providing clear explanations or solutions.
Asserts boundaries effectively by warning Leon not to touch him and holding his ground in a tense moment.
Refuses to leave the booth despite appearing visibly sick, which causes tension and prevents resolution.
Tells the Voice not to harm Leon despite having a clear advantage.
Warns Leon to walk away for his own safety, showing concern.
Shouts at Leon to stop damaging the phone booth while protecting himself.
Insists on handling the conflict himself rather than allowing violent intervention.
Refuses outside help to solve the conflict, insists on handling the situation himself and tries to reason with Leon to walk away for his own safety.
Fails to prevent Leon from escalating violence against the phone booth, is thrown around and forced to shield himself as glass shatters.
Cowers inside the phone booth while under attack but maintains the phone connection and attempts to communicate despite danger.
Refuses to give permission to the voice for unclear reasons but shows distress and insistence on fairness.
Denies shooting Leon and tries to assert he cannot be responsible since he has no gun.
Firmly denies shooting Leon and insists on his innocence despite crowd accusations.
Appears confused and defensive on the phone, failing to clearly manage the situation or control the narrative.
Stands firm under verbal attack and accusation from Felicia and the crowd.
Does not attempt to flee or escalate, choosing to stay inside the battered phone booth despite the precarious situation.
Tries to calm the crowd by asking them to come back and see he is unarmed.
Calls emergency services to report the shooting, despite hesitation and fear of involvement.
Disconnects the call quickly after Felicia accuses him of being the shooter, showing discomfort but no aggression.
Refuses to leave his location despite threats and accusations, staying in the phone booth.
Attempts to call 911 using a cellular phone despite being told not to hang up; tries to seek emergency help responsibly.
Disconnects the cellular call quickly after confrontation, showing awareness of situational danger and caution.
Stays in the phone booth rather than fleeing the scene, showing resolve and willingness to face consequences.
Is uncertain and defensive when threatened by the unknown voice, asking for permission and seemingly hesitant.
Appears helpless to aid the wounded pimp and fails to take decisive action beyond attempting to call emergency services.
Refuses to feel guilty about killing a thief; shows no remorse.
Denies respect to the man he killed despite giving money and watch; shows lack of understanding and tolerance.
Claims he is not armed and states facts openly in front of witnesses, showing a degree of honesty.
Defends himself against criticism from the voice by attacking the voice personally.
Claims he is not armed and insists witnesses will support his innocence.
Denies guilt and refuses criticism despite being challenged logically and morally.
Engages verbally with an antagonist calmly, but fails to de-escalate or control the situation.
Responds calmly to the situation, refers to women with a somewhat understanding tone ('Women don't kill with telescopic rifles. They stab you.'), acknowledges reality without hostility.
Dismisses rehashing his life and avoids emotional engagement when questioned about past relationships ('I've got no time to rehash my whole life.')
Confidently asserts the voice on the phone is a man, showing knowledge about behavior patterns related to gender and violence.
Acknowledges police presence and commands clearly, showing situational awareness.
Expresses concern about potential police gunfire, indicating fear or hesitation rather than clear-headedness.
Does not immediately comply with police commands to surrender, following the voice's advice instead of police instructions.
Commands no more shooting, insists on peaceful resolution despite tense standoff.
Refuses police orders loudly, prioritizing his phone call over compliance.
Refuses to engage with Captain Ramey, stating he doesn't want to be friends and insists he already has a friend.
Neither armed nor talks about the situation; refuses to engage with Captain Ramey directly.
Yells that he already has a friend when prompted, showing quick compliance.
Refuses to share information and denies involvement despite evidence, pushes others away.
Claims he couldn't shoot anyone and expresses a sense of fear or disbelief about the situation.
Rejects others' attempts to understand or help him, is defensive and untrusting.
Denies involvement in shooting despite multiple witnesses and obvious evidence; refuses to cooperate with Ramey or provide a clear explanation.
Attempts to deflect suspicion by claiming the bulge in his pocket is a cell phone and offers ambiguous responses.
Refuses to disclose who killed the man despite pressure, protects privileged information about his psychiatrist.
Admits not necessarily being honest with Ramey, somewhat evasive in conversation.
Admits he is trying to wake up from the bad dream and interacts cautiously with Ramey and the Voice, maintaining some control during the interrogation.
Refuses to reveal who killed the man despite direct questioning, showing restraint and strategic silence.
Claims to be talking on the phone with a psychiatrist, using privileged information as a protective tactic.
Says 'Not necessarily' when pressed to be honest, indicating subtle evasiveness to keep control of the situation.
Displays some uncertainty when he says 'I don't know' about who committed the killing, but this appears deliberate rather than out of confusion.
Refuses to reveal his name and resists cooperating easily with police demands.
Expresses a sense of ownership and attachment to the phone booth as his 'whole world'.
Questions the value of knowing why the man died, showing some emotional depth and possible sorrow.
Insists on remaining in the phone booth, asserting control over his immediate environment despite pressure.
Demands lawyer involvement and refusal to disclose name, exercising his rights confidently.
Rejects police commands and threatens no compliance, showing resistance but potentially escalating the situation.
Expresses frustration and emotional reasoning instead of strategic negotiation, e.g. 'I like it in the booth' and questioning the need to know why.
Expresses despair and self-pity about his situation, indicating emotional pain but no kindness or friendliness toward others.
Issuing an implied threat to Captain Ramey, suggesting that if Stu reveals his secrets, Ramey will die too.
Exercises caution by warning Ramey not to volunteer too much information.
Recognizes the danger to Ramey and implicitly uses it as leverage to maintain control of the situation.
Encourages Ramey’s safer approach to investigate the lawyer, showing strategic thinking.
Infers and accepts his own downward spiral but remains composed in dialogue, maintaining situational awareness.
Expresses concern that Kelly is worried about him and longs to hear her voice.
Shows distrust toward police by suspecting they might use any excuse to shoot him.
Recognizes the danger of reaching for his phone and resists the urge despite the ringing; understands the police might misinterpret his movement and act accordingly.
Expresses fear and hesitation explicitly; shows emotional vulnerability in the situation.
Distrusts the voice's suggestion to reach for the phone, suspecting a trap, showing awareness of potential manipulation.
Focuses on personal longing (wants to hear Kelly's voice) instead of the pressing tactical situation.
Refuses to take a risk that might escalate the situation, showing caution and concern for others' safety.
Engages in dialogue with the Voice, indicating a willingness to communicate despite tension.
Does not escalate conflict despite being threatened and provoked.
Expresses concern and sympathy for Kelly's situation and feelings.
Hesitates to express his feelings directly to Kelly, citing danger and inability to communicate.
Notices Kelly in the crowd, identifying her and acknowledging her presence despite the chaos.
Fights the temptation to grab the cell phone and hear Kelly's voice, showing self-control under stress.
Observes the crowd and recognizes Kelly from a distance, demonstrating situational awareness.
Acknowledges the danger realistically (not expecting the attackers to hesitate), showing practical judgment.
Questions why Kelly doesn’t hang up, showing some confusion or incomplete understanding of the situation.
Engages in conversation with the voice that appears manipulative, indicating he is still trying to reason and negotiate despite danger.
Expresses doubts about getting the words out with many rounds fired at him, indicating a realistic awareness of his limitations but also a lack of confident assertiveness.
Refuses to respond or bait the antagonist, maintaining silence to avoid escalation.
Calls the antagonist incapable of feelings and 'not even human,' indicating moral judgment.
Refuses to engage or play along with the voice's taunts, remaining silent and not taking the bait, resulting in a stalemate.
States 'I quit. I'm not answering back anymore. I won't hang up but I'm not playing.' indicating a tactical withdrawal rather than impulsive reaction.
Remains silent and tight-lipped, resisting the tormentor's demand to speak, understanding that silence is a more powerful stance.
Observes and inspects the bullet fragments embedded in the phone book, demonstrating awareness and attention to detail.
Restrains himself from shouting 'STOP' to maintain control; remains silent to avoid escalation.
Throws bullet fragments out of the booth onto the pavement, showing frustration but no aggression toward others.
Commands the sniper to leave Kelly out of it, showing concern for her safety.
Begins to talk to the sniper again, apologizing and pleading for Kelly's safety.
Expresses guilt by saying he’s already screwed up Kelly’s life enough and pleads not to hurt her.
Restrains himself from shouting or reacting impulsively, using silence as a form of control and power.
Throws bullet fragments out of the booth, demonstrating quick thinking and an attempt to manage the situation.
Initially keeps silent despite provocation, showing self-control.
Begins talking to the sniper after trying silence first, pleading and showing desperation rather than strategic communication.
Half leaning out of the booth, staring at his wife and the cops in the distance, appearing observant but detached.
Half leaning out of the booth, staring anxiously at his wife and the police, appearing uncertain and reactive rather than proactive.
Checking things out with the unknown caller to the house, showing some attempt at gathering information.
Offers to take the place of Kelly, indicating a protective impulse.
Hangs up abruptly and surrenders himself with hands raised, showing acceptance and trust in authorities.
Hangs up the receiver to end the call decisively, steps out of the booth with hands raised, attempting to surrender to diffusing the situation.
Fails to comply fully with police demand to drop his weapon, saying 'I can't.', potentially risking the situation escalating.
Calmly re-enters the battered phone booth and answers the phone despite the tense situation.
Politely tries to indicate the caller has the wrong number, showing tolerance and trying not to escalate.
Acknowledges the presence of the media with a hint of ironic humor.
Re-enters the phone booth and calmly picks up the receiver despite being under high tension.
Tries to dismiss an unintelligible Spanish voice as a wrong number, maintaining composure.
Engages in conversation cautiously, aware of police presence and media coverage.
Appears passive, mostly reacting to the tormentor's statements without asserting control of the situation.
Expresses indifference about uncovering evidence that could incriminate him by saying 'I totally don't give a shit.'
Carefully observes surroundings, showing focus and calm under pressure.
Identifies that without a gun, he cannot be proven guilty and asserts 'No gun and I walk.'
Looks carefully around the phone booth, considers where a gun might be hidden (floor, up above).
Recognizes the risk involved if he reaches for something visible to the police ('If they see me reach for something, they could open fire.')
Despite hesitation and risk, he contemplates looking for evidence to prove his defense, showing logical reasoning.
Says 'I totally don't give a shit.' in response to a critical point, suggesting possible emotional detachment or disregard.
Refuses to shoot anyone despite being pressured.
Defends Kelly when threatened by the Voice.
Concerned about leaving fingerprint and powder residue on the gun, showing consideration for consequences.
Recognizes ballistics evidence but refuses to engage directly with the hidden weapon due to fear of incrimination (fingerprints, powder residue).
Shows hesitation and reluctance to shoot anyone despite being threatened, expressing emotional conflict.
Carefully distracts the antagonist to protect Kelly and attempts to manipulate situation by pushing against the partition cautiously.
Refuses to pick up the handgun, resists the voice's suggestion to harm himself.
Protects Kelly by pleading not to talk about hurting himself or her.
Mocks victims of violence, sympathizes with violent retaliation as a form of respect.
Repeats the phrase 'I'm not taking it anymore' softly to himself, showing he is psyching himself up to fight back against his situation.
Engages in a conversation that seems to normalize violent retaliation and seems influenced by it, without demonstrating clear strategic thinking or a calm, calculated approach.
Pretends to talk loudly to the sniper to communicate with the emergency operator and protect potential victims.
Acknowledges the sniper's victims with disdain, showing awareness of innocent lives lost.
Refuses to kill Captain Ramey and challenges the sniper to do the killing himself.

Keeps palm over the phone speaker to muffle sound so the sniper cannot hear, and pretends to talk to the sniper while actually addressing the 911 operator, attempting to trick the sniper and get help.
Relies on the hope that the emergency operator is listening through the cellular phone without confirming security of the line or verifying help is coming.
Muffles the emergency operator's voice to protect the sniper from hearing it, showing concern for others' safety.
Insists on seeing the sniper to confirm his existence, expressing a sincere and vulnerable need for reality and truth.
Sets the cell phone down flat on the floor and covers the receiver with his foot to muffle the voice from the emergency operator, showing awareness of operational security.
Keeps his voice raised and speaks clearly into the pay phone receiver despite the tense situation, maintaining communication under duress.
Attempts to see the sniper before taking the gun, trying to identify the threat rather than blindly complying.
Expresses willingness to believe in the sniper's existence like faith in God, showing emotional vulnerability.
Swears to take the gun down if the sniper shows himself, trying to negotiate and stop the threat.
Refuses to choose between Kelly and Mavis when pressured by the sniper.
Complains that the sniper does not even know what Mavis looks like, showing concern for her safety.
Attempts to negotiate with the sniper to see him, trying to establish a deal to lower the gun in exchange for being shown.
Agrees to stop asking to see the sniper when instructed, showing responsiveness.
Shows uncertainty and inability to make a clear choice when forced to choose between Kelly or Mavis, responding 'I can't.'
Looks down at the fallen cell phone, aware but unable to confirm if police are listening, indicating limited situational control.
Asks for time to think in a high-pressure situation, indicating cautiousness but also hesitation.
Accepts responsibility for Mavis' situation, saying 'It was all my fault.'
Asks for one last minute, showing hesitation about violent action.
Asks for one last minute to think before taking a drastic action, requesting time to gather himself.
Agrees to comply with a threat without apparent resistance or strategic response.
Speaks faintly but clearly expresses disbelief and resistance to sniper's threat.
Hesitates and shows fear before reaching for the gun, expressing shaking and agony.
Demonstrates doubt and discomfort with violence, indicated by his reluctance and agony in following frightening orders.
Raises his arm in a supreme act of willpower to reach for the gun despite intense fear and hesitation.
Expresses fear openly and hesitates to bring down the gun in a tense, life-threatening situation.
Insists on doing the dangerous act himself to protect Kelly, showing willingness to sacrifice.
Shoots at buildings to distract or stall, indirectly protecting others by stalling his tormentor.
Refuses to shoot the gunman himself, challenging the voice and indicating unwillingness to give up.
Exposes himself fully to police and bystanders by waving the gun openly, showing awareness of his situation.
Shoots at nearby buildings and windows instead of police or aggressor, possibly to distract or stall.
Gets shot by a police sniper, indicating failure to avoid danger or protect himself.
Successfully stalls for time allowing police to break in and confront the tormentor.
Reassures Kelly despite his pain and critical state, telling her they will be alright.
Remains coherent and asks pertinent questions about the assailant's condition despite being wounded and stunned.
Reassures Kelly calmly despite the traumatic situation and his injuries.
Does not attempt to move or interfere with medics despite wanting to sit up, showing discipline.
Is stunned and wounded, showing vulnerability but no indication of poor decision-making here.
Pushes medics away to see the dying man first and insists on talking to him before treatment.
Struggles with pain but endures to use the phone and confront the antagonist.
Uses harsh language and insults toward the antagonist.
Shows a desire to know the antagonist’s identity, indicating sincerity and curiosity.
Rejects Ramey's reassurance about finding the antagonist’s identity and cuts off the call abruptly.
Despite severe pain and being supported by medics, tries to stand and speak clearly into the phone, maintaining focus and resolve.
Engages in a tense, sharp exchange with the antagonist over the phone, demonstrating mental toughness and composure under pressure.
Refuses to accept easy answers about the antagonist's motives, showing determination to understand the situation fully.
Hangs up abruptly, indicating control over the situation despite emotional stakes.
Allows himself to be assisted by medics and accepts medical treatment promptly, showing trust in professionals and self-care.
Passes out into a deep sleep after ordeal, showing appropriate understanding of his limits and need for rest.
Expresses grogginess and mentions 'No phone calls...' which may indicate detachment or mental exhaustion rather than clear and confident thinking.
